column4: how do I make the internal speakers on the computer make a beep.  Clearly it is possible since the system does it when it boots.  I do not want to use the external speakers
man beep
- there is no man page for beep on my system
distro ?
- running 10.4 - actually let me install beep - I see it is an option
install then, there you go
- I have beep now - and according to the man page it would appear that: beep -f 440 -l 250 should play an A for 1/4 a second - I hear nothing - what am I missing
in fact the man page says "beep" alone should work, but I hear notnhing
idk, works here, but there was another solution, I can look up in a minute
: would appreciate that - any guesses as to why the thibg is not working anyway
sound itself works on the system ?
- what do you mean - I get regular Ububtu sounds through the external speakers and I get the beep on boot/POST hrough the internal one
so this isn't the issue
- so any chance of that other solution
and others I see comment on the web that I must disable blacklistpcspkr in the modprobe, I see the file: /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf, once I edit it how do I apply the edit
sudo modprobe -v pcspkr
then try again
if that all doesn't work, there is softbeep, too , though I don't know which device is pointing to the pcspeaker
does it beep at you now ?
that modprobe command worked - thank you so much
if you want it after next reboot, insert modul in /etc/modules
